title: fioras new base kit looks awesome, but that ult makes no sense.
body:
i dont understand the heal zone. thematically and and in regards to the rest of her kit it makes no sense.

shes supposed to be a melee carry, and duellist not a support. it just looks like it doesnt belong in her kit and she could have something more useful that helps her attack the weak spots instead.

how does she even aoe heal by striking people with a rapier?


here is my idea for the ult: 

- after she triggered all 4 zones or killed her opponent after triggering at least 1 weak spot, she gets a limited time ult reset like darius and can select her next target within 20 seconds. if she triggers all 4 zones on that, she can select the next one and so on. 
-  if you really want to keep the heal, make it personal only to her and based on missing health every time she manages to trigger all 4 weak spots.

this would keep her going throughout a teamfight. the counterplay is pretty obvious the same, by not letting her strike at all the weak spots to break the chain.

but the aoe heal takes up unecessary power budget for what is basically a support ability attached to a melee carry.

> [{quoted}](name=Sorgklaan,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=phVEbrEQ,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2015-07-21T19:57:45.932+0000)

> That makes her too much like every other melee carry. I like the heal because it gives her a niche.

this passive alone makes sure that shes different from other melee carries. and there arent that many of them in the first place.

imo every melee carry needs some mechanic to keep himself going, after he finished the first target, or otherwise shes going to end up like an assassin again. able to kill one opponent, and then she has to retreat because she blew all of her abilities.

but what bugs me, is that she gets a rework because thematically she didnt work out like intended. they did a pretty good job with her base kit, but how does a support ult make thematically sense for a duellist thats supposed to be great in 1v1?

-Ult tank
-Deal % health true damage to  tank
-Tank dies much much faster than normal
-Heal zone regens the damage you and your frontline just took as you turn on the rest of their team.

Other than that yea its pretty bad for teamfights.

Hey there! I just entered a similar discussion in another thread, so I'm going to paste it here.

Original [Durzaka's] comment: 

> "Someone on Reddit actually explained it in a way that made some sense to me.
> 
> It is the idea of applause/victory reward at the end of a duel that you have won."

And my thoughts on the matter:

> "Yeah, this is the thematic tie-in that we were going for. Fiora's duel, or 'Grand Challenge,' is a game defining moment for everyone, not just the combatants. Fiora's team should care about whether or not she's successful and be able to join in the celebration if she is.
> 
> Gameplay wise, adding reasons for Fiora's team to care about her in important. Selfish champions can lead to degenerate teamplay experiences, whether they are winning or losing. Accordingly, by adding some team utility to her personal challenges, we can make Fiora a strong 1-on-1 duelist while keeping her team invested in her success. Heal might feel weird here, and I totally get that, but it was the most fitting tool in our box."

so the problem was basically, how to get teams to help her trigger all those weak spots instead of just blasting the target and not caring if she gets it.

now imagine she would have the ult i proposed in the op.

her team would be invested in giving her those weak spots, because she would deal a crapton of true damage over the course of a fight, by chaining resets.

i get the idea, but i still dont like how this ult wouldnt help her really to contineously carry throughout a teamfight. i guess she wont have resourceless short cooldown abilities like yasuo to keep herself going. and she doesnt have an ability like highlander that reduces all her base cooldowns on a kill.

i fear she will again just turn out to be a one trick pony. able to assassinate 1 guy  whos low on hp and cced by her team to trigger the heal. and then thats basically it, because her cooldowns are on cd.

But dealing a "crapton" of damage over the course of the fight is how mechanics of every team-fight works right now. If Riot was looking to make it important that Fiora was in the middle of a team-fight (as opposed to split-pushing or skirmishing in the enemy jungle like she does now) then this healing mechanic is something unique and an incentive to gather together. I think that the healing will be noticeable to the success of a team-fight, but not be so oppressive that it will make team-fights against her unwinnable. Riot will tune it to that effect.

If you tune her ult to only heal her and reset on kills, there is nothing stopping her from picking off a team of 2 or 3 champions that are only slightly separated with those resets. You will actually be forcing a late game, split-pushing Fiora to be met with more than half a team to make sure that you lock her down with enough CC to avoid her ult resets. And if you have a Fiora on your team, she's suddenly just another Tryndamere taking down towers and avoiding team-fights. That hardly seems to garner teamwork and her team being invested in her success.

I wouldn't expect anything that isn't contrived from his explanations on thematic gameplay.

I think her ultimate makes sense until it procs a Janna-sized heal. Like, an Atk Speed or Atk buff of some kind would have made more sense. The Heal looks and feel REALLY out of place. 

Otherwise I like where it's going and I look forward to having a go at it!

No, the heal is the only buff that I can think that would make sense every time. Say for instance that it granted a shield to her allies. Well, that's great, but what if they are in a position where they really don't need a temporary shield? What if she ulted the last standing enemy on the team and they are no where near Baron, Vileman, Dragon and they already have minions under a turret taking agro for them? The shield, just like temporary atk speed or atk damage would be useless if there is no one to use it on. The heal is something that's permanent that can and will be useful in the future of that match, even if it isn't useful right after she's done. Yes, the heal IS out of place. It doesn't just look out of place, it IS out of place, but it's probably the best they could come up with isn't over powered like a permanent attack or movement speed buff. This is something, that if completed, it's not over powered or temporary. It's useful even if they don't need it right that second.

I remember (back when Fiora's reworks was first talked about) a rioter mentioning her ult reducing all of her CDs to near 0 (and bonus arpen iirc) for a fixed number of casts, so it still gives the feeling of her old ult (dashing around the battlefield dealing damage while being elusive to damage) but more interactive (since she remains untargetable and has to use her abilities correctly for max effects instead of pressing R and watching). 

Sorry for the people who worked on that new ult, but it really FEELS like a lazy hasty random idea that was someone had 5 minutes before the rework was announced and that was only kept so the rework won't get delayed.
